title: After roadshow over bail in Karnataka, all gang-rape accused land back in jail
content: In Haveri, police arrested three more suspects involved in a celebratory roadshow after their bail in a gang rape case. This brings the total arrests to seven. The suspects were presented before the magistrate and sent to judicial custody until June 2. Police confiscated vehicles used in the procession. The accused violated bail conditions by conducting the procession with supporters.

title: 'We’re a status quo power, Pakistan is not': Shashi Tharoor in US address - watch video
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading a multi-party delegation, addressed the Pahalgam terror attack in New York, condemning the religiously motivated killings and highlighting the Resistance Front's involvement, linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba. India responded with targeted strikes on terror sites, sending a clear message against terrorism. The delegation aims to foster international cooperation and share India's perspective on combating terrorism across multiple nations.

title: Heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCR; strong winds, rain cause disruption
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Saturday issued a red alert for Delhi and nearby areas, warning of strong thunderstorms, rain, and high-speed winds over the next two to three hours. The alert is part of a Nowcast warning based on the current weather conditions.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: IPL top-two qualification scenarios: GT, PBKS, RCB, MI set for final sprint
content: Mumbai Indians secured the final Indian Premier League 2025 playoff berth, joining Gujarat Titans, Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings. These top four teams now battle for a crucial top-two finish, guaranteeing two shots at the final. Unexpectedly, GT, RCB and PBKS stumbled in their recent matches, intensifying the competition.

title: 'End terror justifications': Indian delegation's big message to Pak in Bahrain
content: An Indian parliamentary delegation, including AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi, engaged with Bahraini figures, denouncing the misuse of religion by terrorist groups and emphasising Islam's rejection of terrorism. Ghulam Nabi Azad sought international support against terrorism, urging Pakistan to dismantle its infrastructure. Phangnon Konyak highlighted Pakistan's continued terror activities since partition, requesting Bahrain's intervention.

title: Guj ATS arrests health worker for sharing BSF, Navy info with Pak spy
content: Gujarat ATS apprehended Sahdevsinh Gohil, a contractual health worker from Kutch, for allegedly leaking sensitive information about BSF and Indian Navy establishments to a Pakistani spy. Gohil shared photos and videos via WhatsApp in exchange for money, after being contacted by the agent in June 2023. He also provided a SIM card registered with his Aadhaar to the agent.

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work after retirement: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: Russia hits Ukraine with drones and missiles, authorities warn of 'new ones'
content: Ukraine faced a second night of Russian attacks involving ballistic missiles and drones, with air defenses intercepting many. Kyiv's military administration reported numerous drones entering the capital's airspace, urging residents to seek shelter. Amidst the ongoing conflict, a large prisoner exchange occurred between Russia and Ukraine, involving 307 soldiers on each side.

title: Earliest monsoon in Kerala in 16 years, hits Northeast same day
content: The southwest monsoon arrived in Kerala on Saturday, eight days ahead of schedule, marking an early start to India's rainy season. Simultaneously, the monsoon reached Mizoram, significantly ahead of its normal date. Favorable conditions suggest further advancement across Goa, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, and other northeastern states, potentially boosting early kharif sowing operations and aiming for record foodgrain output.

title: Biden attends grandson's graduation in first public appearance since cancer diagnosis
content: Former President Joe Biden, recently diagnosed with prostate cancer, made a public appearance at his grandson Robert Hunter Biden II's high school graduation in Connecticut. The family, including Jill and Ashley Biden, celebrated the milestone.

title: MrBeast net worth hits $1 bn, YouTuber becomes youngest self-made billionaire
content: Jimmy Donaldson, widely recognized as MrBeast, has achieved billionaire status at 27, primarily through his YouTube content. Starting with simple videos, he gained fame for challenges, giveaways, and philanthropy. His business ventures, including Beast Burger and Feastables, alongside strategic content reinvestment, propelled him to become YouTube's most-subscribed creator and a leading philanthropist.

title: Bring reforms to increase number of working women: PM at Niti meet
content: PM Modi, chairing the Niti Aayog meeting, advocated for greater inclusion of women in the workforce through policy changes and improved working conditions. He urged states to develop world-class tourist destinations and focus on health infrastructure.

title: Rs 3.5 lakh: Cost of a Bengal villager's legal battle to save her husband
content: The Supreme Court exposed the exploitation of a poor West Bengal woman by the legal system while she fought for her husband's release in a POCSO case. She incurred significant debt, spending Rs 3.5 lakh from the trial court to the Supreme Court, due to exorbitant fees charged by advocates and touts.

title: Government fixes 8.25% PF interest rate for FY 2024-25
content: The government has approved an 8.25% interest rate for over 7 crore EPFO subscribers for 2024-25, following the CBT's recommendation. This rate, mirroring the previous year, offers competitive returns compared to other fixed-income options. The EPFO's consistent performance reflects confidence in its investment strategy, providing tax-free benefits to salaried individuals.

title: Musk's DOGE involvement was 'one of the greatest brand destructions': Expert
content: Marketing academic Scott Galloway criticizes Elon Musk for alienating Tesla's core EV customer base by aligning with Trump supporters, who are less interested in electric vehicles. This shift, coupled with Musk's involvement in European politics, has led to declining Tesla sales in Europe and a significant drop in brand reputation.

title: When Kangana Ranaut revealed she rejected film starring Shah Rukh Khan
content: Kangana Ranaut, known for her bold choices, revealed turning down roles in films like 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan,' 'Zero,' and 'Singh is Bliing.' She highlighted her early struggles and the transformative success of 'Queen' in 2014. Kangana questioned the potential for female actors to shine in films dominated by male superstars, emphasizing her desire for substantial roles.

title: Banke Bihari temple panel opposes corridor clearance, SC to hear plea
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to review its decision approving Uttar Pradesh's redevelopment plan for the Banke Bihari temple corridor in Vrindavan, following a petition by a temple administrator. The petition argues that the plan, which involves using temple funds for construction, was approved without proper consultation and threatens the temple's sacred character.

title: Pak violated spirit of Indus Waters Treaty by inflicting 3 wars: India at UN
content: India has accused Pakistan at the UN of violating the Indus Waters Treaty's spirit through wars and terror attacks since 1960. India claims it has acted responsibly, while Pakistan obstructs necessary infrastructure changes and modifications to the treaty, despite evolving security concerns and climate change. India has put the IWT in abeyance until Pakistan ends cross-border terrorism.

title: Special 17: First batch of women cadets set to pass out of NDA
content: In a historic moment for the Indian armed forces, the National Defence Academy (NDA) in Pune is set to graduate its first batch of 17 women cadets on May 30. Cadet Ishita Sharma, along with her peers, will mark this milestone after three years of rigorous training.

title: NHL: Red Wings could trade Vladimir Tarasenko as Steve Yzerman eyes offseason
content: The Detroit Red Wings are bracing for an active offseason, potentially involving significant roster changes. General Manager Steve Yzerman may trade Vladimir Tarasenko, who hasn't met expectations, with the Washington Capitals possibly interested. Despite trade rumors, Yzerman still believes in Tarasenko's potential, while also planning to pursue impactful free agents to bolster the team's playoff chances.

title: Govt examining release plea of Staines murder convict: Minister
content: The Odisha government is reviewing Dara Singh's remission plea, convicted in the 1999 Graham Staines murder case, amidst legal complexities and multiple convictions. Discussions are ongoing, requiring Union government consultation, as the Supreme Court monitors the decision-making process.

title: Tom Cruise stuns McAfee comparing stunts to NFL QBs' pressure, precision
content: Tom Cruise appeared on The Pat McAfee Show to promote his new Mission: Impossible film, drawing parallels between his stunt work and the quick decision-making of NFL quarterbacks. He emphasized the importance of teamwork, spatial awareness, and leadership under pressure, highlighting similarities between elite athletes and actors. Cruise also shared his plans to continue acting for decades to come.

title: Approach Chhattisgarh police for bodies: Andhra HC to kin of slain Maoists
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court addressed petitions from relatives of deceased Maoist leaders Nambala Keshava Rao and Sajja Venkata Nageswara Rao, who sought the handover of their bodies for final rites. The court directed the petitioners to liaise with Chhattisgarh police regarding body custody.

title: 3 brothers killed in Buxar gunfight over sand dispute
content: A deadly dispute over sand dumping in Ahiyapur village, Buxar, Bihar, resulted in the death of three brothers and critical injuries to two others following a gunfight. The violence, allegedly linked to a former district board member, sparked outrage and road blockades by villagers demanding immediate arrests. Authorities have assured strict action, but the assailants remain at large.

title: Nitish, 4 other CMs give Niti Aayog meet a miss
content: Chief ministers from five states, including West Bengal, Kerala, and Karnataka, were absent from the Niti Aayog's 10th governing council meeting. Despite these absences, the meeting saw high participation with 31 states and UTs represented. The Niti Aayog CEO noted the positive engagement of attendees, while some opposition CMs like those from Tamil Nadu and Telangana were present.

title: Operation Sindoor delegations wrap up visits to Russia & Japan
content: Indian all-party delegations concluded visits to Russia and Japan, securing support in the global fight against terror following the Pahalgam attack. Discussions focused on counter-terrorism cooperation and exposing Pakistan's role in cross-border radicalism. Russia reaffirmed its commitment to a joint fight against terrorism, while Japan expressed unequivocal support for India's stance.

title: 5 global universities get nod to open campuses in India
content: India's ambition to become a global education hub is gaining traction as five foreign universities have received Letters of Intent to establish campuses. The University Grants Commission cleared these LoIs after evaluation. Around a dozen international institutions are expected to have an Indian campus by the next academic session, offering courses in STEM and management.

title: Cocaine worth Rs 6 crore seized from chemical factory, 3 held
content: Maharashtra Police seized 1.3 kg of cocaine, valued at over Rs 6 crore, from a chemical factory in Satara district's Tasawade on May 21. Authorities raided Suryaprabha Pharmachem at the Tasawade MIDC, arresting three employees: Sameer Padwal, Ramesh Patil, and Jeevan Chavan. The company's proprietor and the cocaine supplier were also booked.

title: Parliament must be given Yashwant Varma case report: Congress MP
content: Congress MP Vivek Tankha has urged Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar to promptly share the inquiry report concerning the cash haul scandal at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence. Tankha emphasized that Parliament's role in deciding the fate of judges facing misconduct allegations is being undermined by the delay.

title: 40-year-old man with cancer dies by suicide with family in Jharkhand
content: In Jamshedpur, Krishna Kumar, grappling with a recent blood cancer diagnosis, allegedly orchestrated a suicide pact that tragically claimed the lives of his wife, Dolly, and their two young daughters, Puja and Kirti. A suicide note revealed Kumar's deep concern for his family's future, exacerbated by Dolly's strained relationship with her in-laws.

title: Chief of banned CPI-maoist splinter bloc gunned down in Jharkhand
content: Pappu Lohra, head of the Maoist splinter group Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad (JJMP), and his second-in-command were killed in a gunfight with police in Latehar district. This elimination is part of an intensified crackdown on Maoists and breakaway factions in Jharkhand.

title: 'In interest of institution', HC CJ withdraws case from judge after getting complaints
content: The Chief Justice of Punjab and Haryana High Court withdrew a case from Justice Mahabir Singh Sindhu after receiving complaints, citing the need to protect the institution's and the judge's reputation. A new bench, including the Chief Justice, was formed to expedite the decision and address the controversy. The move was objected to by the petitioner's counsel.

title: Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes set for major comeback and possible contract extension in 2025
content: Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs are gearing up for a powerful comeback in 2025 after a tough Super Bowl LIX loss. With Mahomes still under center and rumors of a major contract extension swirling, the Chiefs remain top contenders. As long as Mahomes leads the charge, Kansas City’s Super Bowl hopes are alive and well.

title: Alia Bhatt wraps up Cannes 2025 in Gucci’s first-ever saree
content: Alia Bhatt closed Cannes 2025 with a historic fashion statement, donning Gucci's first-ever saree. The custom-designed saree, embellished with Swarovski crystals and featuring Gucci's signature monogram, blended Indian elegance with modern flair.

title: NHL salary cap loophole gives teams like Dallas and Florida extra leverage: Report
content: NHL teams in states with no personal income tax, like Florida and Texas, possess a financial edge. This advantage allows them to offer slightly lower salaries while still attracting top talent, as players retain more earnings. Consequently, teams such as the Panthers and Stars can maximize their salary cap, building deeper and more competitive rosters.

title: ‘Monitoring situation closely’: Top government officials meet after Covid uptick
content: Amid a recent uptick in COVID-19 cases, the Union health secretary convened a review meeting, emphasizing proactive monitoring through existing surveillance systems. While most cases are mild and managed at home, the Delhi government has issued advisories for hospitals to ensure preparedness.

title: 'Pak put in abeyance goodwill ...': MEA on why India suspended Indus Treaty
content: India has justified its decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty, citing Pakistan's violation of the agreement's principles following the Pahalgam terror attack. The Ministry of External Affairs highlighted Pakistan's disregard for goodwill and friendship, coupled with cross-border terrorism hindering India's treaty exploitation. Shifts in ground realities, including climate change and engineering advancements, necessitate renegotiation for the 21st century.

title: 'Unity needed to stop return of authoritarianism': B'desh govt fears uncertain future
content: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, faces mounting pressure as rival parties protest, demanding early elections. The government assures democratic reforms before the scheduled 2026 elections, while accusing critics of hindering its progress with unreasonable demands. Concerns rise about potential military intervention, reminiscent of a past crisis, as the army chief supports the opposition's call for elections by December.

title: India Test squad for England tour: Five burning questions
content: Shubman Gill, 25, has been named India's Test captain for the upcoming England tour, making him the fifth-youngest to hold the position. Rishabh Pant will serve as his deputy. The squad includes fresh faces like B Sai Sudharsan and Arshdeep Singh, alongside Karun Nair's return after eight years.

title: 'Like Team India': PM Modi bats for Centre-state unity at Niti Aayog meet
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasised Centre-state collaboration for achieving 'Viksit Bharat@2047' during the NITI Aayog meeting, urging states to develop world-class tourist destinations and future-ready cities. Andhra Pradesh CM proposed sub-groups focusing on GDP growth, population management, and technology-based governance. Several CMs, including those from West Bengal, Kerala and Puducherry, were absent from the meeting.

title: Savannah James shares glimpse of son Bryce James’ convocation
content: Bryce James, son of LeBron and Savannah James, celebrated his graduation from Sierra Canyon School, marking a significant milestone before joining the University of Arizona's basketball team. Savannah shared heartfelt photos and videos from the convocation ceremony, expressing immense pride and excitement for Bryce's future endeavors. The family, including LeBron and siblings Bronny and Zhuri, joined in the celebration.

title: Where to watch Calder Cup playoff: Charlotte Checkers, Laval Rocket stand out
content: The 2025 Calder Cup playoffs are intensifying, with the Charlotte Checkers and Laval Rocket emerging as strong contenders. The Checkers impressively swept the Hershey Bears, while the Rocket face a crucial Game 5 against the Rochester Americans. Tight series define the playoffs, highlighting parity and determination as key factors, promising an unforgettable climax.

title: North Korea Detains 3 Officials Over Accident During Warship Launch
content: The failed launch that crippled the 5,000-tonne warship was witnessed by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un who said the accident damaged the country's dignity.

title: Flight Ops Hit, Trees Uprooted, Roads Flooded As Delhi Receives Heavy Rain
content: Streets were waterlogged and flights were delayed as Delhi and surrounding areas witnessed heavy rains, thunderstorms and strong winds overnight.

title: Shashi Tharoor's "Don't Work For Government" Reply To Pahalgam Question
content: In the US, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor gave a call for the world to come together to fight unitedly against terrorism.

title: "Back To Spending 24/7 At Work": Elon Musk After Brief X Outage
content: After the X outage on Saturday, Elon Musk suggested that he may have been away from his companies for too long.

title: "From Jawaharlal Nehru To PM Modi...": Kanimozhi-Led MPs Slam Pak In Russia
content: A delegation led by DMK MP Kanimozhi Karunanidhi was in Russia to sensitise the diplomatic leadership about terror emanating from Pakistan.

title: Remove Policy Bottlenecks, Increase Development Speed: PM To Chief Ministers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said that global investors are hugely interested in India and the states should utilise this opportunity to attract investments by removing policy bottlenecks.

title: Red Alert For Rain, Storm Issued For Delhi And Nearby Areas
content: A red alert for rain and storm has been issued for Delhi and the National Capital Region by the weather office, warning of squally winds of 60-100 kmph between 10.30 pm and 12.30 am.

title: Heavy Rain Triggers Flash Floods In Himachal Pradesh, 'Yellow' Alert Issued
content: Around 20 to 25 vehicles parked on the roadside were damaged in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Saturday evening following flash floods triggered by heavy rains, officials said.

title: Prayagraj Hospitals Under Threat From Private "Medical Mafias": High Court
content: Taking a serious note of the medical infrastructure of Prayagraj, the Allahabad High Court has said the government medical setup in the city is under great threat from private medical mafias and the SRN Hospital cannot be called a hospital.

title: He Posed As Doctor For Years. How A Patient's Death Exposed Him
content: A young man, armed with stolen documents and a borrowed identity, posed as a doctor for years, even working at a private and a government hospital.

title: Woman Dies By Suicide In UP While On Video Call With Husband: Cops
content: A 28-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide while on a video call with her husband, who is currently working in Saudi Arabia, an official said.

title: 'Victims Of Pak Terrorism Predominantly Civilians': Indian Envoy At UN
content: India's Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Ambassador Parvathaneni Harish, strongly criticized Pakistan's actions at the UN Security Council Open Debate on Protection of Civilians in Armed Conflict.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Are Tomatoes Selling So Cheap? A Much Bigger Problem Is At Play
content: Tomatoes are aplenty and selling cheap this summer across India, and, as they say, there is a problem of plenty, thanks to crop rotation, hybrid seeds and nature's bounty.

title: Most COVID Cases In India Mild, Under Home Care: Sources
content: Most of the Covid cases reported in various states are mild in nature and the patients are under home care, official sources said amid a rise in cases in some countries.

title: Opinion: Opinion: The Mysore Sandal Dilemma: Local Pride vs The 'Pan-India' Myth
content: The Tamannaah-Mysore Sandal Soap saga is far more than just the latest celebrity endorsement to draw flak.

title: Cannes, Parts Of Southern France Suffer Major Power Outage, Probe Underway
content: French police were investigating a possible arson attack as being the main cause for a power outage which hit the Alpes-Maritimes region in southern France on Saturday, including Cannes which is hosting its world-famous annual film festival.

title: Monsoon Arrives Early In Kerala, IMD Warns Of Heavy Rains Across India
content: The Southwest Monsoon has arrived over Kerala on Saturday, nearly a week ahead of the usual onset date of June 1, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: "It's Not A Conflict In Kashmir": S Jaishankar On India-Pak Clash
content: The recent confrontation between India and Pakistan was not a "conflict in Kashmir", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar asserted, saying such a description would be like putting the perpetrator and the victim of the Pahalgam attack at same level.

title: Kerala Man Charged For "Brutally Assaulting" 8-Year-Old Daughter
content: Police booked a man on Saturday after disturbing visuals of him "brutally assaulting" his eight-year-old daughter went viral on social media recently.

title: Central Funds, Water: Non-BJP Chief Ministers' Demands At Meet Led By PM
content: The Niti Aayog meeting on Saturday, in which the Prime Minister urged all states to work together towards the goal of a developed India, also saw some opposition chief ministers raise issues affecting their states, with their main grievances boiling

title: ‘Yachna nahin ...’: How Army delivered bold message post Op Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam massacre, Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, decimating nine terrorist hotspots in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The operation, named by Prime Minister Modi, showcased India's military prowess through videos set to powerful music and verses. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised the operation's swift dismantling of terrorist infrastructure in just 23 minutes.

title: First cherry cargo train set to roll from J&K to Mumbai next month
content: The effort is a welcome initiative if goes off successfully as it will offload the road traffic burden and will enable perishable goods like cherries reach its intended markets with minimal damage

title: My FB page was hacked: Tej Pratap after viral post claims he was 'in relationship'
content: The post had drawn flak from social media users, many of whom reminded the 37-year-old politician of his marriage that took place with much fanfare in 2018

title: Delhi rains: IMD issues red alert; parts of city face severe waterlogging; flight operations impacted at Delhi airport
content: The IMD issued a red alert for Delhi and nearby areas, warning of strong thunderstorms, rain, and high-speed winds over the next two to three hours

title: Where does the RBI’s surplus come from? | Explained
content: How much will the Reserve Bank of India transfer to the Central government for 2024-25? What are the reasons for a record transfer of surplus funds? Why isn’t it a dividend? How does the central bank make money? What is the Contingent Risk Buffer?

title: Plans on the anvil to achieve $2.40 trillion GSDP by 2047: Naidu
content: Highlighting the NDA government’s development agenda at the NITI Aayog meeting, he says the Swarnandhra objectives are in alignment with Viksit Bharat vision

title: How will land ports closure impact the region? | Explained
content: How will it affect Bangladesh’s readymade garments sector? What about other sectors like agriculture? What are the exceptions to the May 17 order? Why has the northeast been dragged into the tussle between India and Bangladesh? Will it affect other countries in the region?

title: Banu Mushtaq | Lady with the lamp
content: The Heart Lamp author and International Booker Prize Winner documents stories from unheard corners, jotting down every aspect of the women’s lives, their drudgery, anxieties, as also their joy

title: Why is a growing lion population a worry as well? | Explained
content:
How is a ‘lion census’ conducted in India? Where are they found apart
from the Gir forest in Gujarat?

title: Railway Ministry approves new train between Agartala and Guwahati, trial run of electric locomotives completes
content: The new train will start from Agartala and stop at Narangi (NNGE) station on the outskirts of Guwahati. However, the schedule for this train has not yet been released

title: Bus incident: Manipur group announces civil disobedience
content: The Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity declared the ‘public boycott’ of Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla after the expiry of its 48-hour general strike

title: Afghans can apply for Indian visas again, including investors, artists, sportspersons
content: New online visa module for Afghans rolled out in last week of April, source says; resumption of visa services comes five years after Taliban takeover in Kabul; applicants need Afghan passport, national ID card

title: Threadbare protection against a harsh summer
content: Women garment workers in the State are facing the brunt of a harsh summer. It is clear that, going forward, there is a role for both the government and the factory managements to protect workers from heat stress on shop floors

title: COVID cases rise to four in Andhra Pradesh as two test positive in NTR district
content: Health Department instructs secondary and tertiary hospitals in State to keep isolation wards, oxygen cylinders, ventilators, PPE kits, etc. ready

title: Piyush Goyal meets EU counterpart for second time in a month on FTA talks
content: Mr. Goyal travelled to Brussels on May 23 from Washington, while India's chief negotiator L Satya Srinivas and his team are already at the EU headquarters for the FTA negotiations.

title: Artillery’s firepower reverberates during Operation Sindoor
content: Modernised with Excalibur rounds and tactical UAVs, the regiment provided crucial firepower against terror camps and in retaliating against Pakistani shelling, officials revealed

title: No one should be able to conquer us, even if multiple powers come together: RSS chief Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasises unity, inclusivity, and strength for India’s national security and cultural diversity

title: Tobacco farmer ‘ends’ life in Bapatla district
content: Recurrent losses in farming for the past three years are suspected to have driven the farmer to take the extreme step

title: State Highways begins counting of vehicles on key roads in Vellore
content: The annual exercise that was put on hold during the COVID-19 pandemic has been resumed due to the rise in the number of vehicles. It involves counting vehicles on key stretches, intersections, and border areas to introduce road safety measures

title: Ant keys emphatic Wolves' response in rout of OKC
content: The Timberwolves responded to a 2-0 deficit in the Western Conference finals with a decisive 143-101 win over the Thunder in Game 3.

title: Clark, Fever lament officiating late in loss to NY
content: The Liberty remained unbeaten Saturday with a 90-88 win over the Fever, who were not happy with the officiating over the final 10 seconds.

title: Oklahoma advances to ninth consecutive WCWS
content: The four-time defending national champion Sooners beat Alabama 13-2 in five innings Saturday to win the Norman Super Regional and clinch a berth in the WCWS.

title: Bregman on IL, Red Sox call up heralded Mayer
content: In between games of Saturday's doubleheader with the Orioles, the Red Sox put Alex Bregman, who has a "significant injury" to his right quad, on the injured list and called up Marcelo Mayer, the No. 6 prospect in baseball and a key cog in their future.

title: Judge (18 HRs) insists he's still 'work in progress'
content: Aaron Judge said he still doesn't feel "too great at the plate" yet this season despite hitting nearly .400 with 18 home runs so far this year.

title: Miami shows 'soul, fight' in Messi-inspired rally
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said his players showed soul and fight to come back from a 2-0 halftime deficit to draw 3-3 against the Philadelphia Union on Saturday night at Subaru Park.

title: Coward forgoes Duke, to remain in NBA draft
content: Cedric Coward is keeping his name in the 2025 NBA draft and will forgo the opportunity to play at Duke next season, he told ESPN.

title: Buffalo seals dynasty with historic NLL three-peat
content: The Bandits pulled away for a 15-6 victory in Saturday's decisive Game 3 and became just the second team in NLL history to win three consecutive championships.

title: 🏈 Vols-Bruins 'QB swap' leads portal superlatives
content: We awarded superlatives for a spring college football transfer portal window that saw Tennessee and UCLA swap quarterbacks, among other intriguing moves.

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Knicks' season is in jeopardy
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: After 18-year wait, Arsenal are European champs again, ushering in thrilling new UWCL era
content: Arsenal are shock winners of the UEFA Women's Champions League, the first time the trophy went to a club other than Barcelona or Lyon in a decade.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: What does a lap of Monaco in a McLaren feel like? Restrained
content: Lapping the streets of Monaco, one is left with a common feeling within F1: This place is holding cars back.

title: Ancelotti bids emotional farewell to take place among Real Madrid greats
content: Even legends get fired at Real Madrid after a trophyless season, but Ancelotti leaves as the club's most successful coach, and a tough act to follow.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Commanders hoping Deebo, Tunsil, draft picks will keep Jayden Daniels ascending
content: Washington believes veteran additions Samuel, Tunsil and draft picks at OT, WR will bring different dynamic to offense.

title: Is Betts poised to pass Trout as best player of their generation? Let's find out
content: Mookie Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Mike Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: Arsenal stun Barça in final to win UWCL title
content: Arsenal forward Stina Blackstenius struck a late winner as the London team shocked holders Barcelona 1-0 on Saturday to claim its second Women's Champions League title.

title: Bonmati in 'disbelief' after shock UWCL defeat
content: Barcelona midfielder Aitana Bonmatí was left in disbelief and wishing she could start the game again after the Spanish champions lost 1-0 to Arsenal in Saturday's Champions League final.

title: Sunderland's 95th-minute goal seals PL return
content: Sunderland staged a remarkable comeback to beat Sheffield United in the Championship playoff final and return to the Premier League after seven years.

title: Sources: Ansu in talks to leave Barça for Monaco
content: Barcelona forward Ansu Fati is in talks to join French side Monaco next season, various sources have confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: De Bruyne heading toward Napoli move
content: Kevin De Bruyne will open talks with Napoli next week over a free agent move to the newly-crowned Serie A champions, rejecting the chance to move to MLS with Chicago Fire FC, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ancelotti, Modrić bid Bernabéu emotional farewell
content: Carlo Ancelotti and Luka Modrić said goodbye to the Bernabéu after Real Madrid beat Real Sociedad 2-0 in the team's last game of the LaLiga season.

title: Sources: Liverpool leading race to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool are leading the race to sign Germany international Florian Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen, sources have told ESPN.

title: Salah named Premier League Player of the Season
content: Mohamed Salah was named the Premier League Player of the Season on Saturday after the Egyptian enjoyed a stellar individual campaign.

title: Congratulations, you've been promoted to the Premier League! Now what?
content: The past six teams to come up to the Premier League have gone straight back down. How can Leeds, Burnley and Sunderland break that cycle next season?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gunners shift their sights towards Leão
content: Could AC Milan star Rafael Leão be headed to Arsenal this summer? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: Nominations window open for businessline Changemaker Awards 2025
content: Nominations can be made across five categories of awards — Changemaker: Social Transformation; Changemaker: Digital Transformation; Changemaker: Financial Transformation; Young Changemaker and Iconic Changemaker. One flagship award goes to the Changemaker of the Year which is awarded to a person or an organisation that has ushered in far-reaching change.

title: Mamata Banerjee’s absence from NITI Aayog meet draws flak from Opposition
content: BJP and Congress leaders criticise West Bengal CM for skipping key meeting amid stalled central funds; TMC cites prior “insult” as reason

title: Not a favour, but a responsibility: Delhi High Court on child maintenance
content: The court made the observations while hearing a husband’s appeal challenging a local court order requiring him to pay interim maintenance of ₹50,000 per month to his wife for the care of their two children

title: Emergence of new COVID variants detected in India
content: Indian SARS-CoV-2 Genomics Consortium (INSACOG) data shows detection of COVID-19 variants NB.1.8.1 and LF.7 in India, driving rise in cases in Asia

title: Supreme Court sets aside life imprisonment in murder case on grounds of insanity
content: A Bench of Justice A.S. Oka, who retired on May 24, said the medical check on the man, Dashrath Patra, was conducted five years after the crime and thus “meaningless”

title: Trinamool rallies behind Abhishek Banerjee’s call to restore Rash Behari Bose Memorial in Tokyo
content: Political observers see gesture as part of larger project to honour Bengal’s freedom fighters and assert regional identity

title: Punjab, Himachal seek special financial packages at NITI Aayog meet
content: Chief Ministers flag step-motherly treatment, pending dues, and demand support for border and hill state needs

title: Employment generation in IT sector growing under DMK regime, says Mano Thangaraj
content: Minister distributes offer letters to candidates during the mega job fair organised in Nagercoil; six job fairs were organised in recent months to give opportunities to youth in Kanniyakumari district, says Minister

title: Bengal teachers plan to intensify protests if government ‘fails to meet deadline’
content: They have sought an audience with the State Education Minister and say they will wait for a response till Monday. They say they will start writing to MPs across party lines urging them to address their issue in Parliament

title: Politics of the palm: A protest wrapped in a festival in Tamil Nadu
content: At Narasinganur village in Villupuram district, toddy tappers from across the State gathered to celebrate the palm tree in all its glory. This day-long festival may seem like a joyride on the outside but in it exists an underlying protest

title: West Bengal government bans 137 medicines
content: This comes as the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation found over 196 substandard drugs across India

title: Monsoon arrives in Kerala ahead of schedule
content: India Meteorological Department confirmed arrival of the monsoon three days before its forecast of May 27

title: Twin flyovers to flank Edappally by 2025 end
content: Vehicles waiting at the bottlenecked junction will be rerouted through underpasses of two flyovers under construction since early this year on the junction’s northern and southern sides, according to the National Highway Authority of India’s plan

title: Andhra Pradesh hands over Civil Supplies building to Telangana
content: Civil Supplies Ministers of both the States discuss key issues at a meeting in Hyderabad; 16 flats in Shanti Shikhar Apartments also being allotted to Telangana

title: Heavy rain: DDMA holds meeting to review safety arrangements in Kozhikode
content: Instructions issued to village-level rescue squads to remain prepared to meet rain-related calamities and arrange facilities in advance to address relocation requirements

title: Kambalakonda Eco-Tourism Park: Visakhapatnam’s green retreat with cottages, wildlife and thrills
content: A scenic transformation is underway at Kambalakonda Eco Tourism Park with upgraded trails, cottages and renewed focus on biodiversity

title: HC orders DGP to take action against police officers interfering in civil dispute
content: The court says the ADSP issued a notice under Sections 91 and 160 of the Cr.PC. Issuance of summons under these Sections arises only after the case is registered

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan objects to film bodies’ ‘disrespectful attitude’
content: The government will henceforth engage with representatives of the film associations only and not at the individual level, he asserts

title: After brief X outage, Musk says refocusing on businesses
content: Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter) faces major outage affecting users in India, U.S., and Canada, as reported by Downdetector

title: NH 66 works: stir gains momentum
content: Protests revived after newly developed NH 66 corridor in north Kerala developed cracks in several places over the past few days

title: Kerala braces for dengue, leptospirosis outbreaks as monsoon season arrives
content: Seasonal epidemics of dengue fever and leptospirosis outbreaks during monsoon months has been a regular feature in the State since the past several decades

title: Assam’s Nagshankar becomes model temple for turtle conservation
content: ‘Kaso Mitras’ or community turtle guardians were acknowledged for their contributions to the conservation of the reptiles

title: Andhra Pradesh government launched ‘One Family, One Entrepreneur’, to foster a culture of entrepreneurship in every household, says MSME Minister
content: This initiative plays a pivotal role in the development of MSMEs as drivers of self-reliance, innovation and job creation: Kondapalli Srinivas

title: 2019 phone-tapping issue: CAT stays govt. notice initiating fresh probe against senior IPS officer Alok Kumar
content: Alok Kumar has alleged that a fresh inquiry is ‘designed solely to create artificial hurdle in his career progression’ when he is due for promotion as DGP

title: Overlooked fallen electric post claims motorist’s life at Kumbalam
content: Residents accused the KSEB of negligence for improperly erecting the support post meant to draw supply wires and the police of overlooking the fallen post

title: Workshop imparts life skills to girls
content: 38 students from 10 government schools in five villages in Alappuzha take part in Girl Empowerment Mission (GEM) workshop

title: Government committed to development of stadium in every district, says Minister Bharath
content: Industries and Commerce Minister, along with ACA president and Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath, Kurnool MP B. Nagaraju and others inspect the ACA cricket ground coming up at Munagalapadu village in Kurnool

title: Operation Sindoor not a one-off initiative: PM Modi at Niti Aayog meet
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: As it happened: Updates, highlights and more from Liberty-Fever
content: new york defeated the Indiana Fever 90-88 in a nail-biter on saturday . caitlin Clark continued her 3-point shooting slump after starting 0-for-7 from deep . she converted a triple through contact at the 1:04 mark of the third quarter .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .

title: What's at stake on the final weekend: Titles, cup finals, UCL, relegation
content: the 2024-25 season has entered the closing stages . the battles for the major honours, european qualification, relegation and promotion reached their conclusion . here's a roundup of what's at stake and what could be decided in the english premier league , german Bundesliga , Spanish LaLiga , Italian Serie A and French Ligue 1 .

title: From Alcaraz to Gauff, ranking the 2025 French Open top contenders
content: top-ranked Jannik Sinner came off a three-month doping suspension . the men's side have reached a combined eight finals in Slams or 1000-level events in 2025 . aryna Sabalenka, coco Gauff and mirra Andreeva have reached the finals .

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .
